**moFF from the command line with identified features in tab-delimited file as input**
Put your raw file in another folder a called _rawFolder_.
Run moFF \(match-between-runs and apex) using the following command:
To set all the parameters and options of moFF, please
Read the full list in the "documentation":https://github.com/compomics/moFF/blob/master/README.md#entire-workflow
Collect all the results in the out
Run moFF-GUI and set the folder where PeptideShaker is installed and the out
Put folder where all the results are collected.
'Apex' is just the apex MS1 extraction, and 'matching-between-run' for the match-between-runs module plus the apex module.
Insert the Thermo RawFile or mzML files.
For each raw file you have to associate also the relative cpsx file.
Moreover, you can also insert the fasta and the mgf files used in PeptideShaker/SearchGui.

Setting of the moFF parameters \(Figure 5): 
  - XiC retention window
-Peak retention time windows for matched peak
- Weighting/unweighting and the activation of outlier filtering and its width value
- Selection of a set of specific peptides \(loaded as tab-delimited file) and use them as training set of the mbr procedure instead of the shared features of the runs.
Collect your result in the out
